item.title: Why I like Python
item.description: Some (brief) thoughts on why I like Python. I meant for this to be longer, but didn’t actually get around to finishing it.

item.title: Python AES
item.description: Cryptography isn’t available by default on python. One needs to install the PyCryptoÂ toolkit to make it work. Looks something like this: from Crypto.Cipher import AES import base64 key = "x0Dx0Fx07x0Fx0Cx0Fx08x0Fx06x0Fx09x0Fx06x0Fx03x0Fx0Fx06x0Fx0Fx0Fx0Fx0Fx0Fx06x0Fx09x0Fx06x0Fx03x0F" objAes=AES.new(key, AES.MODE_ECB) plaintext='This is sparta!!' #looks nicer with base64 enc = objAes.encrypt(plaintext) print "Encrypted: " + base64.b64encode(enc) print "Decrypted: " + objAes.decrypt(enc)
